exceptions.exn: In environment q, p : nat H : q < p H1 : q = div q p * p + rem q p HeqH1 : H1 = div_rem_spec1 q p The term "p" has type "nat" while it is expected to have type "?p <> 0".

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
q: nat

Goal:
q < p -> rem q p = q

Premises:
rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments rem (_ _)%nat_scope
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
div_rem_spec1 : forall q p : nat, q = div q p * p + rem q p
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_gcd p q r1 -> is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
is_gcd_div : forall p q : nat, divides p q -> is_gcd p q p
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
rem_0 : forall q : nat, rem q 0 = q
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
is_lcm_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_lcm p q r -> is_lcm q p r
is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd q p r
is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> k <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - k) r
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
plus_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (k * q)
is_gcd_moduplus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q + k) r
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
Nat.mod_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.max_unicity : forall n m p : nat, n < m /\ p = m \/ m <= n /\ p = n -> p = Nat.max n m
Nat.min_unicity : forall n m p : nat, n < m /\ p = n \/ m <= n /\ p = m -> p = Nat.min n m
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p

```coq
intros H.
remember (div_rem_spec1 q p) as H1.
remember (div_rem_spec2 q p) as H2.
destruct (div_full q p) as [n [r [Heq Hlt]]].
rewrite Heq in H1.
rewrite <- H1.
apply rem_prop with (n:=n).
- exact Heq.
- exact H.
Qed.
```

original: intros H. remember (div_rem_spec1 q p) as H1. remember (div_rem_spec2 q p) as H2. destruct (div_full q p) as [n [r [Heq Hlt]]]. rewrite Heq in H1. rewrite <- H1. apply rem_prop with (n:=n). - apply Heq. - apply H.
